page.title: 16DALMELLINGTON CHURCH-2
page.content:
Inside the church is light and airy. The floor of the nave slopes slightly towards the pulpit and communion table at the east end. There is a narrow gallery at the west end. Pillars of cast iron, painted, support the roof.
There are several memorials to local people in the church. Five of these are stained glass windows which include in them references to mining which was until recently the major employer in the district. Mounted on the walls are duplicate memorials to two men who died last century serving in India.
The church itself was built for and given to the village by the Cathcart family of Craigengillan on the far side of the Doon valley.
